description:
Rally Vincent knows her weapons well, while her partner Minne May Hopkins loves to play with explosives. The pair run a gun-shop illegally and one day Bill Collins of the ATF, blackmails Rally and Minnie May into working for the ATF. Little do they know, that they are getting involved in a mission larger than they could imagine.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Cars
tags.description: Centers around the use of automotive vehicles.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

ナスターシャ・ラディノフ

node.description:
Married to [Jaxon C. Lee](https://anilist.co/staff/95871/)
Full name is Amanda Beth Winn-Lee
Resides in Los Angeles. Born in Houston, Texas

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/moritakeshi)

Son of the baseball player Tooru Mori.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/757550602180173824)

Sonoda moved to Tokyo in 1984 and joined the animation studio [Artmic](https://anilist.co/studio/72/). There he worked as a designer for titles such as [Gall Force](https://anilist.co/anime/2060/) and [Bubblegum Crisis](https://anilist.co/anime/1347/). He left Artmic in 1991 and began work on his manga, [Gunsmith Cats](https://anilist.co/manga/31319/), which remains as his best known work to this day receiving both Harvey and Tezuka Award nominations.

He also has a deep knowledge of firearms.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/757550602180173824)

Sonoda moved to Tokyo in 1984 and joined the animation studio [Artmic](https://anilist.co/studio/72/). There he worked as a designer for titles such as [Gall Force](https://anilist.co/anime/2060/) and [Bubblegum Crisis](https://anilist.co/anime/1347/). He left Artmic in 1991 and began work on his manga, [Gunsmith Cats](https://anilist.co/manga/31319/), which remains as his best known work to this day receiving both Harvey and Tezuka Award nominations.

He also has a deep knowledge of firearms.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/229166670/)

After graduating from the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering at Fukuoka University, he joined the animation studio [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). There his first work as an in-betweener was on [Hiatari Ryoukou!](https://anilist.co/anime/729/). Afterwards, he went freelance and worked on films such as [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/) and [Kiki's Delivery Service](https://anilist.co/anime/512/) before debuting as a key animator on [Lupin III: Bye Bye, Lady Liberty](https://anilist.co/anime/1415/) in 1989.

Him working on [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)'s films as an animator led to him being selected as a director for [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597/). A movie which remains as one of his most noted works today. In 2007, he directed his first TV series, [Bokurano](https://anilist.co/anime/1690/).

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/).

He is known for his sense of timing, which gives his animation often a stop-motion like feeling. He studied as an animator under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/), under whom he often worked on productions like [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) or [You're Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1372/). He does also team up often with animator [Hirofumi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101188/), who has influenced Matsutake's animation.

Aside of working on anime he has also worked on several games, mostly the Tales of series, where he served as animation supervisor on the animated sequences in most of the series' games.

Also close friends with [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/), [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/千羽由利子)

One of the nine founders of [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/245226/Yuuichi-Tanaka)._
Long-time employee of [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/)'s.
Originating from Green Box.

Hamasu's animation mainly focuses on character acting, and his scenes often feature minimal camerawork with a heavy emphasis on expressive facial and body animation. Much like [Kouichi Arai](https://anilist.co/staff/121208/), he was heavily influenced by [Junichi Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/140660/) and the late '80s realism. Early in his career he was employed at Toei Animation, and was thus a recurring presence in the studio's OVA works such as [Xanadu](https://anilist.co/anime/5920/), [Crying Freeman](https://anilist.co/anime/1153/) and [Vampire Wars](https://anilist.co/anime/1765/). His rising prominence during the early '90s allowed him to participate on [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/), and from thereon he has been in high demand for feature films.

In 1993, Hamasu animated the car chase on [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/)’s episode of the [JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/666/). The scene impressed Kon enough for Hamasu to end up as a character designer and animation director on [Perfect Blue](https://anilist.co/anime/437/). He was also set to serve a similar role in [Millennium Actress](https://anilist.co/anime/1033/), but was replaced in the role by [Takeshi Honda](https://anilist.co/staff/103303/) due to having contracted a severe tendon inflammation. He appeared on all of Kon’s films, as well as [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/) until the director's passing.

More recently he has mostly worked on [Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) and [Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/)'s films.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/moritakeshi)

Son of the baseball player Tooru Mori.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/村田和也)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).
Highly praised for his mechanical drawings by [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/).
Shinichi Hashimoto is an animator.
__Atsuji Kaneko__ is a Japanese episode director and storyboard artist.
Highly praised for his mechanical drawings by [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/d82SpoPvvj7qIU4)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/木村貴宏)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松本憲生)

Originating from Tatsunoko's animators training institute, where he met [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/). Though primarily an action animator, he’s demonstrated impressive range elsewhere like in his scenes for [Haibane Renmei](https://anilist.co/anime/387/) and [Kaguya-hime](https://anilist.co/anime/16664/). He has the reputation of a fast and disciplined worker. [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/) said that he must have a “secret” for producing such a large volume of superb cuts.

Though one of his earliest assignments was as an in-betweens checker for [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/), his first major job was on [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), working under the director of the series, [Kazuhiro Furuhashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100655/). He would collaborate with Furuhashi again on Rurouni Kenshin, [You’re Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1577/), and [Hunter x Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/136/). Around this time Matsumoto was also mentored by [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/) on [Irresponsible Captain Tylor](https://anilist.co/anime/569/).

Matsumoto’s character animation is loose and full of smears, often looking like featureless masses in individual frames. He draws smoke without highlights, a tendency that earned the nickname “Norio smoke” and has been imitated by animators like [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/). He occasionally storyboards his own scenes as he did for the 12th episode of [Birdy Decode:02](https://anilist.co/anime/5074/), the [third Naruto movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2144/), and episodes 31 & 85 of [Rurouni Kenshin](https://anilist.co/anime/45/). Prefers battles that take place in wide-open spaces with lots of forward momentum and background movement. Influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/) and [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/), and has adapted elements of their approach for a wider audience.

Whenever he serves as animation director on an episode, he does a lot of the key animation work himself. He also soloed the 7th episode of [Eat-Man](https://anilist.co/anime/1704/) and the [Kuragehime](https://anilist.co/anime/8129/) ED. He failed attempting to solo the 39th episode of You’re Under Arrest, and requested his name not be on the telop despite animating the vast majority of the episode.

Famous for his work on the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) franchise, in which he often collaborated with Atsushi Wakabayashi.

As a well known animator with a wide network of connections, he regularly helps and receives help from his friends.

(Source: Animators Wiki)
